title: Can I buy a cheap bike with the assumption that it will last for less than 1 year?

title: How much is it to replace the battery in a 2014 Honda Civic?
self_text: I'm not a mechanic and don't know anything about cars so I need help. My car is starting to have trouble turning on, like its struggling to start up. It might be the alternator or something else but I'm hoping it's just the battery.  I live in NYC so labor costs are high. I also want a good battery that will last me for at least a year.  I can do some research online myself but wanted to get some quick answers from people who might know more than me. Thanks!

title: Can you get a job as a programmer with no degree?
self_text: I've been hearing that it's becoming more common for people to work in tech without degrees, but is it true? If so, what steps would you take to get your foot in the door and how can you demonstrate your skills?

title: Why are there no good movies about the Vietnam War?
self_text: I know, I know...Platoon is a good movie, but it's not very popular with people who actually fought in the war and they say it doesn't portray what it was like to be over there. So if Platoon isn't good, why aren't there any other good ones?  I'm starting to think that the war was just too bad for anyone to make a good movie about it.

title: How do you know when to use a comma?
self_text: I’m just bad at it. Like, really bad. So how does someone who is bad at commas and punctuation learn? Do they need to study grammar or is there an easier way? What are some tricks or rules that could help me improve my skills?

title: Why is there a difference in the way people say "I" and "me"?
self_text: I'm just wondering why it is that if you are speaking about yourself, you can either use the word "I" or "Me". It makes no sense to me as both of them seem to have similar meanings but they're used for different reasons.

title: I want to know if it's okay to eat the bread crust?

title: What is the deal with the word "literally?"
self_text: I have noticed that people use it a lot, but like literally what does it even mean? Is it just to add emphasis? Or am I missing something?  I know its original definition, which is using it in a literal way (i.e. he literally blew my mind), but its gotten so overused that now I hear people saying things like, “I literally died.” So when did this start and why?

title: What's the deal with people who hate their life, but don't want to die?
self_text: It seems like a lot of people say they hate their life, and that they wish it would all end, or that it would be better if they were dead. But then when you ask them about killing themselves, they get all defensive and shit, and say "No way, I love my life too much".  What is up with that?? Like what do they even mean by loving your life too much?

title: Why does the US have a President?
self_text: I'm an American and I don't know why we have a president, it seems unnecessary to me

title: What's the deal with the fact that people are still getting their old 360 games, but not Xbox One or Series X/S games?
self_text: Why is it so hard to get ahold of any older Xbox 360 games and they're always expensive as all hell? I went on eBay and there was one copy of Halo 4 for over $125! But I can find plenty of Xbox One and Series X/S games going for cheap because they're more readily available, even if they're just as old.  I'm just confused why this is the case.

title: Why do the Russians want to invade Ukraine?
self_text: What does Russia have to gain from invading Ukraine? If Ukraine is just a country of 45 million people, why would they spend billions on troops and tanks in order to invade them?

title: Is it okay to have a non-monogamous relationship if you are only attracted to one person and that person is not interested in being with anyone else?
self_text: I'm asking this question because I'm really confused. I'm bisexual, but I've never been romantically attracted to anyone other than my current girlfriend (who has no interest in being with anyone else). So when people ask me if I want to be polyamorous or have an open relationship, I just say "no" because I don't think I would enjoy having sex with someone else even if I could find someone I was sexually attracted to. But then people say that the point of being polyamorous isn't necessarily about sex, but about emotional connections and sharing intimacy with multiple partners. And that makes me feel like maybe I should at least consider it, but honestly I'm just not sure.  I don't know if I'm missing something here.   Does anyone have any advice for me?

title: What does it mean to be a "professional" something?

title: Is it okay to use a public bathroom to go #2?

title: How do you feel about the “10,000 hours” rule?  Is it real or a myth?

I read somewhere that Malcolm Gladwell said if you want to be good at something you need to put in 10,000 hours of practice, but I’m not sure if that’s true.  What are your thoughts on this subject?

I have seen people having multiple accounts so maybe there's a way around it, but I would like some help from anyone who knows the answer!

Is there a way to find cheaper options or ways to make grocery money stretch farther?

title: Is it possible to get the same amount of sleep when you take a long nap, than if you were to sleep through the night?
self_text: So I am not sure how much sleep my body needs or what happens during sleep and if getting an adequate amount of sleep is all that matters. If you have any information about this topic let me know.

self_text: I can’t seem to get it out no matter how hard I try, even after air freshener and opening windows for hours! It’s been going on for months now and I really want it gone.  Is there anything else I can do?

title: Is it weird to have a crush on someone you’ve never met?

title: How did the world become so obsessed with "wokeness" and identity politics?
self_text: I'm not trying to be divisive, I just want to understand how it became such a big deal. I've been following current events for years now but I still don't get why everyone is always talking about race, gender, etc. It feels like it came out of nowhere.

title: Does anyone else feel like the “cool” people in school always peaked?
self_text: I’m curious if anyone else feels that way, and why.  I was never a cool kid so I don’t have a lot of experience with them, but it just seems to me that a lot of those people peaked during high school and haven’t done anything since.  Maybe it’s because they had nothing to prove anymore or maybe it’s because their confidence came from being cool rather than actually being good at something.   I also wonder how much of this is nostalgia on my part. It's easy to remember the past as better than it really was.

title: Why do we not have an official name for the colour of skin that is lighter than white?
self_text: I mean, it's a completely different hue from White people, and just saying "light-skinned" doesn't really cut it. It's like asking a painter to paint something "a shade of grey". They would need to know how dark or light it is. So why don't we have names for these colours?

title: Why do people eat a hotdog?
self_text: I'm confused why people like eating a hotdog, it tastes and feels bad.

title: What are some of the worst things about living in a place where it gets very cold?
self_text: I've lived my whole life in warm places and am considering moving to a colder area, but I want to know what really sucks before I make the jump.  I'm not talking about just having to wear more clothes or dealing with snow, I'm talking about stuff that you can't fix by wearing warmer clothing.  Like if you have to worry about your pipes freezing, or if your car won't start on a bad day. Or how the sun is gone for like half the year.   What are the downsides of living somewhere like Minnesota, Wisconsin, Maine, Vermont etc.?

title: Is there a way to tell how long someone has been using Reddit?

If not, what is the oldest Reddit account that exists?  I know it's possible to look up when a specific sub was created, but does anyone know when Reddit itself started?

self_text: It seems like there is a big difference in maturity and perspective.  What do you guys think?

title: Why do people say that they are “a little” gay?

I know there are people who don’t identify with any specific orientation but what about those who say they are “a little” gay? Do they mean they like guys a little bit but still prefer girls? Or do they mean they aren’t fully gay and just have some attraction to the same sex? I really just want to understand where these people are coming from because it confuses me so much.

title: What is the difference between a regular, unflavored protein shake and a flavored one?
self_text: Is it just like added sugar or something?

title: What’s a good way to tell if I am being ghosted?

How long does someone usually wait before deciding that they are being ghosted?  Do you think it depends on how close the relationship is? And what do you think of people who ghost others without giving any explanation?

I know it’s going to be difficult but I’m willing to put in the work. Any advice would be appreciated!  I will also take recommendations for books or podcasts that might help me get started.

title: Why are people with ADHD so good at art?
self_text: I have seen a lot of artist that say they have ADHD, is it possible to be better at art because you're distracted all the time?  I want to know more about why there's so much correlation between ADHD and art.

title: What is the difference between a man and a woman?
self_text: I'm curious, can someone explain to me what are the differences between men and women that make them different from each other?  I'm not asking about biological differences (like hormones or reproductive organs), but more about their behavior, personality traits, etc.  For example, it seems like men are more aggressive and competitive than women, while women are more emotional and nurturing. But is this just a stereotype? Or is there some truth to it?  Also, how much of these differences are due to nature vs. nurture? Are they innate, or do they develop through socialization?  And finally, how do these differences affect our relationships with each other?

title: Can I use a phone with no service to make emergency calls?
self_text: For example, if my phone is off and someone takes it from me and tries to call 911 would the phone be able to dial them without being activated or having any kind of plan for it?

title: How does the sun stay in space?
self_text: It's not like there are any wires holding it up!

title: Is it illegal to install a camera in my apartment?
self_text: I live with a roommate who is very paranoid and is convinced that someone is trying to break into our apartment. He wants to install a hidden camera to see what happens if they do, but I’m worried about the legality of installing a camera inside our shared living space without my permission.  I don't think we have any rules on cameras in our lease.  Is he allowed to do that?

title: What is the most useful piece of information you know?
self_text: I'm not looking for a fun fact, I want to know something that has helped you in life.  The reason I ask is because when I was younger my dad taught me how to use a multimeter and it's saved me so much money on things around the house.

title: Why do people feel like they can’t trust politicians?
self_text: I find it funny that the media keeps trying to make a case for Biden being an honest person, while everyone who isn’t a politician knows he is just another crooked liar. They are all liars and crooks! What does America have to look forward to in the future when we are only offered corrupt leaders?  I think there needs to be a law banning any former politicians from holding public office again, or making money off of their past positions. This would help encourage more good people to enter politics because they know they won’t become millionaires at our expense. It would also give the public a little bit of hope. I don’t even understand why people vote if they are just going to get lied to and stolen from anyway.  I guess the simple answer is, we need term limits. But then what will these career criminals do with themselves once they are out of office?

title: Is it okay to use the word "ghetto" in conversation?
self_text: I'm trying to learn more about what language is appropriate and not, but I was told by my friend that using the word "ghetto" can be offensive.  I don't know why. What are your thoughts on this?

title: I'm a 19yo male and my parents have been trying to get me to go to therapy for the past year because they are worried about my mental health, but I feel like I don't need it. What should I do?
self_text: I've never had any thoughts of harming myself or others.  I enjoy spending time with friends and family. I have a stable job.  I am not depressed or anxious. My parents are just very overprotective and want me to be "perfect" in their eyes. They said that everyone needs therapy at some point in their lives, but I disagree. I think therapy is only necessary if you are struggling with something serious. Should I go to therapy just to make them happy? Or should I stand my ground and tell them that I don't need it?  What do you guys think?

title: Is it possible to get a new job during your current job without losing the benefits of both jobs?
self_text: I'm currently working at a company that has great health insurance, and an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), but low pay.  I recently interviewed for a job with a higher salary. But after looking into their healthcare plan, it doesn't cover my existing medical conditions. And they don't have an ESPP.   If I were to accept the job offer, would I be able to keep my benefits from my original employer as well? Or am I forced to lose those benefits if I take the job offer?

title: Is the sun's energy actually infinite?
self_text: I have a basic understanding of how nuclear fusion works, but it is not something that has ever been explained to me in detail.  Is there a limit to how much energy can be created by the sun through fusion? Or is it infinite?   I am asking because my science teacher told us today about how we are going to run out of fossil fuels and will eventually need to find another source of energy. He said that solar power could potentially solve our problems since the sun has an "infinite" amount of energy, which made me question if that is actually true.

title: What is the most annoying thing people do when they're drunk?
self_text: I had a friend who, when she gets drunk, constantly says "I love you" to everyone and anyone, even strangers!  And then can't remember any of it in the morning...

title: How can I stop my cat from going on top of the kitchen counter?
self_text: It’s a big no-no but she won’t learn it!  I tried getting those mats that stick to surfaces and they work for a little bit, then she just starts jumping around them. Any other ideas?

title: Why is it so hard to get a job as a kid?
self_text: I'm currently 14 and want to work for the summer, but every time I try to apply, they say I'm too young or that there aren't any jobs available.

title: What's the most ridiculous thing a landlord has asked you to do?
self_text: I just got an email from my landlord asking me if I could go down to the basement and check on her water heater for her, so she doesn't have to come in contact with any of us tenants.  I'm not a plumber.  What's the most ridiculous thing your landlord has asked you to do?

title: How do you know when to stop eating?
self_text: I'm not talking about feeling full, but how do you know if you have had enough food for the day/week/month/year?

title: Is it possible to be addicted to a drug without actually feeling any effects?
self_text: I read an article about someone who was prescribed a placebo for depression, and they started feeling better after taking it. The doctor told them that the pill didn’t contain anything but that they still felt like they were on something. That led me to think, could you theoretically become addicted to a drug (like cocaine) if you took it while not feeling its effects? Or would your brain eventually register it as being harmful even if there are no noticeable side effects from the drug itself?  I know this is just speculation, so please don’t take my question too seriously.

title: Why are we so obsessed with getting to the top of mountains?
self_text: I'm not saying it isn't cool, but why do people want to get to the top of mountains so badly? I guess that's a bit of a weird question considering how many millions of people climb them every year.  I think I understand the appeal for explorers who want to be the first to summit or something like that. But even if you aren't trying to make history, what's the point in climbing a mountain? I mean there is literally nothing up there except rocks and snow and cold. You have to pay money to go up there, put your life at risk, use a ton of energy, etc.

title: What does it mean when someone says “Oh, that’s just a thing” or “It’s just a thing”?
self_text: Like what? I don’t understand why they say it like that.  I’m not trying to be rude, but please explain.

title: Do you think it's possible for a person to be in love with more than two people at once?

title: How do you tell if a girl is teasing or being mean?

I know that teasing should be fun for both people involved, but when it doesn't feel like she's enjoying it as much as I am, I don't know what to do.  What are some signs of playful teasing vs. meanness?
